title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Work With Us
body: Work With Us          Join the VALR team!     The National Park Service seeks students, professionals, and other qualified individuals from many academic disciplines and trades for a wide variety of internship, seasonal, and permanent positions nationwide. We encourage all interested and qualified persons to apply. We want a workforce that reflects the diversity of America. You must be a United States citizen to be eligible for consideration for employment. Certain jobs may have age and physical qualifications. Generally, you must be at least 18 years of age.  The NPS fills all positions in accord with U.S. Office of Personnel Management OPM regulations. Normally, a person seeking an initial appointment to a permanent position must gain eligibility on an appropriate OPM register.  How Jobs Are Filled   Federal agencies fill jobs in several ways. Not all jobs are open to external applicants. Agencies can promote an employee, hire an employee who wants to transfer from another agency, reinstate a former Federal employee, or request the names of applicants from an OPM register.   NPS Employment Opportunities General Bulletin — Job opportunities and how to apply Current Federal Employment Opportunities at USAJOBS — Most career employees begin as seasonal or temporary, but here you can see all available federal positions Volunteers at USS Arizona Memorial — Start out as a volunteer at the memorial.   Your Application   If you are pursuing your first federal government position, the best source of information is the job announcement. It will explain what the job duties are, what experience or education is necessary to qualify, the pay, and where to send your application.  For more help with your application, visit USAJOBS, the government's one-stop source for federal jobs and employment information, or call 1-478-757-3000 or TDD 1-478-744-2299.
